column4: I can't get my desktop visual effects to change to "Normal", it keeps saying that it can't be activated or whatever
Whats wrong with it?
your vga driver not supported
no, because it worked yesterday, it stopped working after Firefox botched up and I had to force quit it
well that's the problem
is there any way I can fix it? Re-install my VGA Driver or something?
try login as another user
No, that didn't work, but I just made the account
No, that didn't work, but I just made the account
you login to gnome as another user and try to set it to normal?
yeah, I made another user and switched to that and then tried to change it, it returned the same error
i works for me... try reinstall the vga driver then
Uh, how do I do that?
what vga you use?
I don't know, whatever came stock in my HP Pavilion a1254l
try lspci
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82915G/GV/910GL Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 0e)
maybe xserver-xorg-video-intel
no such command
what command?
that's the vga driver you use, not a command
what is the reinstall command?
ap-get --reinstall
sudo apt-get reinstall-- xserver-xorg-video-intel?
